column1: short, and dismissively hoicked through backward square leg! Decent pace, but that was nailed!
wider line, 86mph, might have been given as wide but for a toe-ended thump to point
climbing through to the keeper, swinging away
jabbed through third man, nip away from the bat but well enough connected
solidly into line and defended back down the pitch
tapped into the leg side, that's a good recovery from that first-ball four
back of a length, and sure enough, this one tails back a touch and cracks Finch high on the pads
curling into the pads, a bit of an ambitious single but Buttler's shy from behind the stumps is about as hopeless as you'll ever see in international cricket
curling away from the left-hander, two slips in place as Head leans forward to defend
width, more swing, driven off a fat under-edge, out through square leg
lovely strike, meeting the full length with a compact drive, perfectly bissecting the two cover fielders
tight line outside off, poked out to the off side
back of a length, lifting sharply as FInch misses out on a cramped pull
wicket to wicket line, blocked solidly back down the pitch
tight to the off stump, pushed into the covers
defended back down the wicket

dropped but what an effort! Hales at short midwicket, stuck out his right hand with the ball almost behind him, Ben Stokes at Trent Bridge fashion, but he couldn't claw it in as he fell to the ground!
defended back down the pitch
too wide, and slapped firmly through the covers
swinging late, half driven down to the man at mid-off
swing once more, wide of off stump, but Head can't line it up with a back-foot slap
through to the keeper on a wide line once more
half an appeal, and England think seriously about the review, Head was deep in the crease, but that was down the leg side
solidly forward to block on a middle and leg line
banged in short, over the shoulder
on the pads, worked to backward square leg
nudged off the hip, into space on the leg side
deflected round the corner once more
tight line on a full length, Finch defends firmly off the back foot
very full, and Wood is almost up for the lbw appeal, but reckons rightly that that was heading down leg
full and straight, no way through there, pushed to cover
slashed to the leg side, no great foot movement as Head plays the swing off the pitch
fenced into the gap clean down the ground, that's superb timing! Met the ball on the top of the bounce and eased it through long-on
chiselled in the air, out to deep midwicket
crunching drive! This is better intent from Australia, striding out to meet the ball and flogging it clean through the covers
back of a length, glided out to point where it is gathered on the run to prevent the single
tucked to the leg side
back of a length, Wood falls over in his followthrough, but he's delivered the ball nicely into the channel. Poked to point
sweetly on-driven! Just a touch over-pitched from Wood, right under the eyeline and launched back through the bowler's grasp
flicked to leg, looking for the single, but Buttler swoops
banged in short, Head ducks
much wider on the crease, Head reads the revised angle and flicks urgently out through square leg
whipped through backward square leg. The runs are starting to flow now
defended off the back foot, gathered in the followthrough
tapped to the leg side, gathered at short midwicket
fuller length, hovering around the off stump, and blocked back down the pitch
back of a length once again, on a middle and leg line, Finch tries to work it square but can't connect properly
another lovely drive, clean through extra cover with a big stride and a full face
pushed onto the back foot, blocked out to point
round the wicket, on the pads, tucked to short square
full length, strikes the pad as well as bat, but the line from round the wicket makes the sweep a safe option
faster through the air, punched uppishly to short midwicket
whittled into the leg side, short midwicket is in action again
that's well played, lots more air from Root, and Head skips down the pitch to drill through wide long-off
flipped through the leg side to complete the over
outside off, slammed through point. A bit of a nervy sighter
wide line once again but a sharper pace, climbs over another attempted cut/carve
on the back foot, punched back down the pitch without much conviction
chopped down into the crease, and so nearly onto the stumps! Misses the timbers by a whisker, and Buttler is wrong-footed too
firmly onto the front foot to block this time
beautiful drive. Too wide from Overton, in the slot for a tonk, and battered through the covers
round the wicket, nudged to the leg side
tweaking into the left-hander, met with a full face on the back foot
whoops! An attempt at violence from Head, but he loses his shape as he skips down the pitch and is lucky to get enough bat on the ball to spare him the stumping
worked to leg
tapped into the covers
advancing down the track, and worked to the leg side
well bowled! That's better from Overton, a yard fuller, and tighter to the off stump. Angled across and lifting past the left-hander's edge
shorter and wider, slapped to cover for the single
flipped into the leg side
tight line on off stump, and pushed back down the pitch
tip and run, and through they gallop, a single to mid-on
blocked back down the pitch
thumped down to long-off
nurdled into the off side
cracked into the covers, and up comes Head's fifty. A well-compiled knock, from 43 balls. He's dominated this opening stand
tapped to the leg side
advancing down the wicket, crashed to cover
on the back foot, fenced into the covers
thumped on the up to short cover, tighter lines from Overton
clipped out to deep midwicket, a long chase for the sweeper
a swishing pull, out to deep square leg. Good connection and two more to the total
punched firmly to mid-off
a cramped cut to backward point
punched to the off side
round the wicket once more, cramping the right-hander for room on the pads, and tucked square
advancing the bowler, but can't rifle the drive through the gap
flipped to short midwicket
looped up, onto the legs, clipped to the leg side once more
solid block on the front foot
faster and flatter, nearly wheedles its way through
outside off, good lift from back of a length, jabbed down into the pitch
wider line, patted to short cover
advancing down the pitch, worked to the leg side for another single
drilled to wide mid-off, but with no great timing
clipped out to the leg side
fuller length, attacking the top of off, deflected behind point
round the wicket again, punched to mid-off
down on the sweep, could have been a wide if he'd left it, but instead merely tapped to the man on the 45
worked to the leg side again
crashing drive, advancing down the pitch,  but well intercepted in the covers
nudged to the leg side, can't get him away
Finch was advancing, but Root saw him coming, held it back in the flight. That's a tremendous over
googly to start, punched off the back foot, through long-on
looping onto a good length outside off, tapped off the back foot to mid-off
wider line, cracked with decent timing to wide long-off
spanked out to wide long-off
turned off the pads, and this could be trouble! Thoughts of a chaotic single, but wisely turned down as square leg swooped
firmly blotted back down the track
wide outside off, urgently cut through point
on the pads, nurdled to the midwicket sweeper
advancing down the track but just another single, clipped to the leg side
tossed up, way down the leg side, Finch smashes it behind the keeper. A rare poor ball, perhaps anticipated a stumping chance, but it was too telegraphed
flicked to leg once more to bring up the 100
keeps low as it slides in from outside off, chopped through point

a dirty half-tracker, and tanked straight to the man at deep midwicket! Head is aghast, what a gruesome way to give it away. The long-hop lures him out of his cautious mindset, he seeks to clear the rope, and England have their opening!
stays over the wicket, tossed up and tapped back down the track
flighted, chipped to the left of the bowler, bump ball
googly, spinning away and sliced, but gully can't get a hand on it! Superb diving effort but it loops out of reach, don't think he quite got to the ball
worked into the leg side off the pads
tossed up and nudged for one
lobbed up leg side and worked off the pads
stays round the wicket, Marsh taps the ball back
tossed up, no width and Marsh defends
comes across, dabs the ball down square on the  off side for a single in front of point
pushed through flat on the pads, Finch tickles it fine but the man on the edge of the ring prevents one
full and straight, tapped gently away
pushed through and chopped back down the track
punched into the ground to the left of Rashid, who gets a hand on it but can't prevent one
floated up and driven through the covers for one
pushed through, can't get this one away
full, outside leg stump, possibly the googly but Marsh is to the pitch and sweeps forcefully past short fine leg, Moeen sprawls but can't prevent four
worked off the legs to midwicket
flat on the pads and Finch is happy to nurdle away
tossed up and stroked through the covers on the front foot
flat and on leg stump, tickled into a gap at midwicket
flighted a bit more, Marsh drives and it comes off the inside half of the bat
dobbed on the stumps, worked away
pushes this one down the leg side
floated up full and Marsh prods one more into the covers
comes down and works a single down the ground
flighted, Finch blocks to leg
hi ho Silver! That's gone all the way over long-on, picked the googly and slugged it powerfully beyond the ropes
flatter, outside off and steered away off the back foot
pushed through and whipped to short midwicket
nicely bowled, slips in the googly and Marsh is beaten as the ball thuds into the gloves
flat on the stumps, can't do much with it
floated up on leg stump, flicked for one more
Marsh taps into the covers
angled in with the arm and Marsh shows this a straight bat
floated up full and Marsh dinks one into a gap out towards deep cover
on the stumps and nudged off the pads again - that's fifty for Finch, a sedate innings so far but we know he can go big
floated up and driven into a gap coming forwards
goes for the sweep but picks out the fielder on the edge of the ring
flighted, pushed back down the track to the bowler
slips in the Bosie again, this time Marsh misses flicking across the line and is hit on the pad, pitched outside leg
comes forward and drives this through mid-on for a single
gives this some air, Finch reaches forward and blocks
short of a length and worked off the hip behind deep backward square for a couple
tossed up and defended on off
flat, pushed into the covers... another dot ball
angled in and Marsh flicks against the spin to midwicket
flighted, this time Marsh manages to pick a gap coming forwards
dobbed on the stumps one last time and Finch blocks - that is Root bowled out, 10 overs for 44, only the second time he has completed his allocation in ODIs
Rashid tosses the ball up and Marsh prods it back
full on the stumps, paddled away to leg for a single
lobs up the googly, hits the inside edge as Finch presses forwards
flighted, comes across on off and drives for one
floated up full on leg stump, March whips one down the ground
full and juicy, gets it a bit too straight, Finch whumps it back over long-on again! Second six, a meaty blow down the ground, turns that into a decent over for Australia
tossed up and driven firmly, placed in front of deep cover but Billings does well to haul it in
round the wicket, full and punched in front of the sweeper again
flatter and tapped towards point
worked down the ground
tossed up, Finch turns the ball into the leg side with the spin - fifty stand between these two
pushed through on off, Marsh taps it to the fielder
legbreak, spinning away outside off, Finch drops back and cuts
flighted, drifting across as Marsh comes down, defended
floated up and clipped to mid-on
can't get this one away
stays back and plays with the spin through square leg for one
gives this some air, Finch defends watchfully
pushed through from round the wicket, Marsh dabs into a gap
fired in straight, Finch blocks it back down the track
flatter, worked through square leg and they come hustling back for two
on the stumps, Finch taps it down
flighted, outside off and met with a forward block
touch short and Finch can stay in the crease and clip a single behind square
short of a length, Finch helps it down towards deep backward square leg, Marsh has to hurry and put in a dive at the bowler's end... but he's fine, after a check with the TV umpire
length ball, 80mph and Finch blocks, gets an inside edge between his legs and they scamper through
pitched up and clipped off the pads
shortish, 81mph and Finch runs it away off his pads, fine leg has to run across and they get comfortably back this time
length in the channel, met on the front foot and blunted through the covers for one
angled across, Marsh drops back and dabs into the ground behind backward point
gives it a bit of air, drifting leg side and Marsh swings across the line... maybe just flicked the pad on its way through
flat outside off, Marsh drops back to cut for a single
tossed up and tickled back down the ground to long-on
flat, Marsh stays in the crease and punches though mid-on
pushed through outside off, not much turn and Finch dabs it to short third man
angled in flat and Finch defends back to the bowler
length on the pads, Marsh clips through midwicket and comes back for a second... a direct hit from the deep and he would have been struggling!
short ball, Marsh pulls and gets a swirling top edge... but it lands well in front of fine leg and they trot through
here we go, Finch takes a bite out of Overton - clumps a lofted drive high over mid-off, there's no man back and it bounces away to the rope
back of a length, defended into the off side
shortish and worked off the legs, two more there
pitched up, around off stump and Finch toe-ends a drive to mid-off, they hurry through for the single
fired down on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
little bit of turn this time and Finch works the ball through square for a single
Marsh gets this away, the sweep has been his preferred outlet for aggression against spin and he sends this skimming through backward square leg for four
tossed up and clipped down the ground
flat outside off, Finch drops back and dabs another single
on the stumps, clipped down the ground for one more
short of a length, Marsh hit on the pads playing back
dug in, Marsh swivels on the pull for one through midwicket
crrrrrrrrrrrrrrunched! That's a bit more like it, Finch bullies this off a length, a forearm jab through mdiwicket for four
on the stumps, worked for one
short of a length, Marsh continues to tick over with a leg glance
dug in, but that's a powder-puff half-tracker and Finch wallops it handsomely over deep square leg for six! Finch into the 90s, they're kicking up a gear
angled in and tucked for a single
flat on the stumps, defended to the on side
no width and Finch tucks it back to the bowler
on the stumps, Finch gets right back and works this French cricket style square of midwicket to bring up the Australia 200
dragged short, Marsh is off balance cutting and only gets one to deep point
pushed through, Finch chops another single through backward point
length, 84mph and sliding into the pads, Finch clips to mid-on who is back a little and they take one
touch full, worked into the leg side, there's a couple more as the man hares in off the rope
short of a length, 84mph and forced to mid-on off the back foot
angled across, Marsh reaches for the cut and gets one through the covers
pitched up, goes for the yorker but it drifts leg side and Finch gets a tickle on the ball, sending it wide of Buttler for four
better line, Finch blocks on off
tossed up, Marsh goes down town... launched into the bleachers at long-on! Takes him to his half-century, a clean, crisp swing and fetched well back beyond the rope
comes down and drills this for one
pushed through, Finch goes back and dabs late for a couple
tossed up, Finch sits on it for a single into the covers... that's his hundred, sixth against England in ODIs. Off comes the helmet, taking in the applause. Time to unleash?
pushed through and defended
swatted away over midwicket! Moeen drops short and Marsh rocks back to heave it over the infield for four more
oh, pinned him in front! Finch is plumb lbw playing across the line, Wood has the breakthrough out of nothing! It was all very placid out there, and now Finch has missed a straight one
outside off, a thick outside edge, through to third man
solidly onto the front foot, and walloped to mid-off. There's been a lot of that today, technically correct drives straight to the fielder. Oodles of respect for the bowling
flipped to the leg side
bowled him! That is a beauty from Wood, shaping in, just a hint of reverse maybe, skidding through Stoinis's half-cocked defences. Had he got forward he might have had more chance ... of lbw
stabbed through third man to get off the mark
round the wicket, back of a length, chopped out to deep cover
a high-elbowed drive, straight to cover
width outside off, stabbed to point. Marsh is hobbling somewhat now, but no runners allowed
lines up the big drive, but merely nudged to cover
tucked off the pads to the leg side
roll of the wrists, eased down to long-on
round the wicket, punched from an upright stance to short midwicket
outside off, dabbed to point for another single
dabbed out to point
pushed to cover, looking for the single but sent back
guided into the covers once more
hauled round the corner to the sweeper at deep midwicket
smacked down to long-on, ambitious wind-up
eased to the leg side once more
googly, Agar plays it from the pitch and slams it out through cover
huge wipe at the googly, and there's a review for a stumping! Didn't remotely pick it, but his toe slid back just in time
boshed out to wide long-on, played from under the nose
swept, from a very tight line. Got enough bat on it in the end, but that would have been very adjacent!
round the wicket, full length, Marsh has a stand-and-deliver swing, and a spiralling top-edge plugs behind the bowler's head. An ugly mow
swished out to fine leg
slashed over the keeper's head, a reasonably well directed bouncer, but enough bat on ball to sail to the rope
boshed down to long-on for another single
round the wicket, pumped down the ground, back past Wood's outstretched hand
rolls the fingers on a full-length delivery on leg stump, slashed into the off side. A good over
tossed up and thumped to the rope. That's the way to do it! Hammers straight as you can get without hitting the stumps. That'll help
Agar advances, Rashid sees him coming, adjusts his length. Well bowled
googly, edged, gone! A celebration as low-key as this entire innings. Agar fails to pick the variation, and deflects a slashing cut into Buttler's gloves
legbreak, mown out to deep square leg to get off the mark
clipped to the leg side once more
big swing across the line, hits the pad, and England review! It was turning, so may have done too much. Let's see... umpire's call, top of leg stump. Close!
now then, the one-legged Marsh lines up Willey's length, and pummels him over the sightscreen!
swinging down the leg side, and clips the pad as it does so. The perfect result that time for England
swinging into the pads again, and thuds out to the leg side
back of a length, swinging in, and a fat leading edge loops into no man's land at mid-off
clipped on the up, gathered on the bounce at deep midwicket
that's an impressive bit of improvisation from Carey! Down on one knee, reverse-slapping Willey up and over short fine leg, gets lots of bat on it, and pilfers the boundary! A good over for Australia
googly, starts wide, spins wider
absolutely battered! He picked that googly with no problems, a massive wipe across the line and deep into the stands at cow corner
shorter, wider, pushed out of the front of the hand, and just helped behind square
fuller length, smeared along the deck to deep midwicket
hooned through the covers, this is a terrific turn of pace from the hobbling Marsh. Cracking it on the up to ruin Rashid's figures
thumped out to the deep

smashed high over the leg side, and up comes Shaun Marsh's second hundred of the series! Absolutely brilliant acceleration in the later stages of his innings, and it's a 91-ball hundred, which is useful in any context
low full toss, swinging into the toes, and Carey holes out to deep midwicket! He nailed it, to be fair, but straight to the man.

stunning from Roy on the long-on boundary! Another massive wind-up, it dips late on the boundary's edge, where Roy clings on, running towards the rope. He has the presence of mind to pick out Craig Overton ten metres away, running round from midwicket, his team-mate accepts the side-handed lob, and that is Willey on a hat-trick!
cracked to mid-off to survive the hat-trick ball
thumped out to deep midwicket
edged, gone, and it's three in the over! Who says Willey isn't a death bowler? Neser makes room outside leg, feathers his off-side slap and Australia are subsiding rapidly
yorker, well dug out. That was a lively over
attempted yorker, tailing into the pads, chiselled round the corner to bring up the 300
an under-edged smear, Buttler does well to drop a glove on it
attacking the stumps on a full length, clipped hard to long-on
well bowled again, a pinpoint yorker, nothing for Paine to do but dig it out
wider line, speared down the leg side this time
crunched out to deep cover
rolls the fingers on another attempted yorker, chopped out to backward point
smeared along the ground to long-on, lining up the outswing and connecting well enough

round the wicket, angled into the pads, and Willey strikes again! Another slog across the line, but was he struck outside the line? Paine can't be bothered to review... but that was umpire's call ... very marginal!
slammed high in the air, who wants this? Willey wants this! He sprints out to midwicket, but can't quite reach it to complete his five-for
length ball, fizzes through a wild swing
cracked airily out to cover, where Morgan pounces with one hand, which briefly discombobulates Richardson. But he gets back safely
thumped to cover, and that's the end of Australia's spirited innings
short and on the hip, Roy clips it firmly away, past the dive of short fine leg for four off the first ball! Well, I suppose Finch did the same
pitched up on off, diligent lines and Roy defends this time
touch shorter, forced down into the ground and towards mid-off
comes across, Roy gets a little tangled up trying to whip the ball to leg
length in the channel, thick-edged down to third man
tight lines, YJB defends towards mid-on... decent start from Neser
back of a length, turned off the body and wide of mid-on for one
similar length, rising over off stump and Bairstow gets off the mark with a similar turn to leg
short and rising, Roy rolls the wrists and sends the ball in front of deep square leg, they come racing back for two
larruped through extra cover! What a shot that is, not overly full but the bounce is true and Roy steps out to ping it through the infield, rebounding off the middle of the bat with interest
good length on off, defended this time
touch too full, that's stroked for four more! Leans into the shot, all timing back down the ground... England into their stride
good length and punched back to the bowler
pitched up and smashed through the covers again, YJB eases the boundary count on by one
comes across and pushes a length ball into the off side
slams into the back leg, Neser goes up... but Michael Gough shakes his head! Maybe nipping down the leg side? Ah, perhaps some inside edge on it, too
turned into the midwicket area
full outside off, YJB throws the hands but doesn't connect cleanly and the ball dribbles to cover
banged in, too quick for Roy on the pull... but nevermind, his top-edge flies all the way over fine leg for six! Safe option, with no one outside the ring down there
dug in back of a length, Roy rides the bounce
straighter line, Roy blocks it back down the track
touch short, angling in with the arm, tucked defensively into the leg side
too full, that's in the slot again and Roy skewers it through the covers for another boundary. Ho hum
back of a length, rising up towards the hip, Ropy only needs to tuck it away on the pull and it races to fine leg for four more!
pitched up and driven through cover, there's a sweeper out there now
fullish, on the stumps and worked towards mid-on
full in the channel, this keeps a touch low as Roy swings for the hills and fails to connect
short but taking the pace off, Roy is through his pull shot early and gets a bottom edge wide of the Paine, who gets across
too straight, this is flicked off the legs wide of short fine and Stanlake has to lumber into gear to prevent a boundary
fourth-stump line, driven on the up to extra cover
pushed through, bit of turn but the ball sits up nicely on off stump and Bairstow carves it through point for four
tossed up, tapped down into the covers
slightly short and steered through backward point, lovely placement but it's just about reeled in in front of the rope
pushed through quicker, bit of overspin as Roy waits in the crease and tucks to midwicket
floated up, punched to cover coming across
flighted, spinning in and worked towards mid-on, it's a tight single but Roy calls it and looks to be home... although the throw is wayward
back of a length, rasped into the off side and they pinch one with the fielder back
on the pads, that's a poor ball with no protection and Bairstow just calmly fiddles it away to the fine leg boundary - that's the England 50 up, lickety-split
fullish, middle and leg stump, clipped through midwicket
on the legs again, Roy doesn't have to exert himself in glancing four more through backward square
shot! That is dismissive from Roy, coming forward to a back-of-a-length delivery and he just throws the hands through a punch past point
on the stumps and tucked for one
looped up on off and Roy works to midwicket
uses the feet, comes down and whips in front of deep midwicket for a couple
goes back and cuts into the off side
tossed up and dinked to mid-on coming forwards
tight lines, Roy taps into the covers again
and theeeeeerrrre's the release boundary... touch short and there's the width for Roy to crunch another cut to the fence
hammered through cover point, four more! Bairstow is standing on leg stump, doesn't need much width and he cashes in from Richardson's loosener
angled in straighter, tapped into the on side
good bumper, YJB ducks
short of a length over off stump, swatted to cover
Bairstow trying to make room again, driven firmly into the ground
dug in, tennis-ball bounce and Bairstow panhandles it up and over short third man... off the toe of the bat, I think, but it nearly sails all the way!

pushed through, beats the outside edge and Paine whips off the bails... they are going to check upstairs, Roy did shift his back foot fractionally but I don't think it was in the air at the time. No, Dharmasena's happy he was in
tossed up and pushed back down the ground - half-century for Roy, continuing his purple form
flat on off stump, YJB chops into the off side
ooh, nearly bowls him! Bairstow backs away and swings hard, the ball scoots through and misses everything... Past leg stump
tapped back down the track
tossed up and punched into the covers
length ball, Roy presses forward and gets an inside edge for one
slashed to third man, off the outside edge but it lands safely
stays a touch low as Roy comes across and turns to leg
length ball, Roy opens the face, that's a cheeky outside edge steered wide of the keeper... four more
angled in straighter, back of a length and taking the pace off, tickled through the leg side for one
gets it through, past the dive of mid-off! Touch too full and YJB gets forward, spanks a drive... not completely out of the middle but it will run away
pushed through on off, Roy dabs it to cover
comes down and misses with a work across the line
flat on off stump, rocks back and slaps the ball to backward point
comes forward, nicely flighted and Roy elects just to dink it through the covers for one
slightly too straight, Bairstow works it off his pads
floated up full, Roy tickles one down the ground to long-off
length in the channel, Roy drives on the up through cover
lovely stuff, sizzled straight back down the ground! Touch full, Bairstow just hits smoothly through the line - no violence, just timing
slightly back of a length,YJB tries to thrash this through the covers and miscues into the turf
pitched up, again he swings wildly and it stays a little low, through to Paine
punched off the back foot into the covers, a misfield helps them through
Roy is on off stump and punches towards mid-off, again they steal the single
tossed up and driven through the covers

good length, YJB gets on top of his drive and stabs it well in front of the sweeper, allowing them to come back for two... that's the century opening stand between these two, brought up in similar time to Trent Bridge on Tuesday, I'd wager
punched through the off side
flatter ball, steered to gully off the back foot
shouts of 'catch!' as Roy chips just clear of the leaping extra cover... not quite what he was aiming for, but picks up one to long-off
slashed off the back foot, runs behind square
touch short, that sits up nicely and Bairstow bullies a pull away to backward square leg
similar length, this seams in and tucks him up, YJB pulls and misses this time
chopped through cover point
muscled away to wide long-on! Didn't quite time that but Roy gets four more, hoicking the ball flat past midwicket
comes across and pokes the ball square
pitched up and Roy tries to launch this into Northumberland, comes off the bottom of the bat but lands a yard or two short of mid-on
tossed up and driven down the ground
flat delivery in the channel, Roy can free his arms and slap one to the sweeper
chopped in the air off the back foot, not totally in control and Finch flings himself to his left... but won't get there, couple more in front of the man in the deep
tossed up and driven through cover point for one, that is Bairstow's fifty, too, easy does it
lummy, here comes the reverse-sweep, not got hold of it completely but the ball skitters past short third man and away
uses the feet and punches into a gap
short of a length on off stump, Roy cracks it to extra cover
dug in, the angle is straighter and this is pulled square to the man on the rope
short of a length, pulled in front of the deep midwicket sweeper
length outside off, Bairstow comes across and punches to mid-off
in the channel, clubbed off a length past extra cover, YJB wants two but Agar is quickly in off the rope to keep them honest
fired in full, Roy digs eh ball out to midwicket and immediately sets off... but the throw misses!
looped up outside off, Roy walks down and clips to long-on
pushed through and cut for one going back in the crease
flat delivery, Roy steers a single through point
flighted, punched into the off side
exasperation for Lyon as Bairstow sweeps on off stump, just gets a tickle of bat on it and the ball races to fine leg for four
pushed through, nudged towards mid-on
attempted yorker, almost in the blockhole... but Roy digs it out with such sweet timing that he nearly beats long-on with a straight drive, they come back for two
punched on top of the bounce into the covers, good throw as they steal the single... but Bairstow beats the direct hit from Neser!
short ball, YJB swats a loopy top edge down to fine leg
pushed into a gap in front of point
pitched up and tucked into a gap at cover
maybe a slower ball, but that's looped away outside off
on the stumps, whipped firmly into the leg side as deep midwicket charges around
swept firmly out through square leg
hello, massive tweaker and Roy is struck on the back pad! Lyon reckons it is going over the top, but it was nicely flighted
slapped back down the track, straight to the bowler
opens the face, guided past the diving point and gathered on the run by the sweeper
down the track and blocked, a touch uneasily
a nice rhythm in this over from Lyon, forcing Roy to be on his guard as he drives back down the pitch
too short, muscled out through deep square leg
in the slot, and slogged ferociously on the up through wide long-on!
big inswing, but sliding down the leg side as Roy gets a fat inside-edge
outside off, biffed through the covers
forward and poked to the off side
outside off, and crashed through point
pushed into the covers
down on the sweep, can't make full contact
forward and defended to the leg side
on the back foot, tapped into the gap in the covers.
worked off the pads to the leg side
tapped down the pitch, England are playing the Goat with respect. He's a seasoned performer in an otherwise rookie line-up
clubbed into the off side, not a lot of foot movement as the ball scythes through the line
opens the face on a slashing drive, guided to third man. Roy was a bit eager for the single there! Has to reverse-ferret in an undignified rush
cracked into the covers again
worked on the up to wide mid-on
whipped out to deep midwicket, that's beautifully timed and bissects the field to perfection
angled defence to third man

absolutely battered over wide long-on and after missing out (relatively) at Trent Bridge, he's made amends here with his hundred! From 81 balls, the fastest of the three so far today, and his sixth overall
tucked to the leg side to keep the scoreboard ticking
nudged leg-side once more
aims something expansive down the ground, and Roy has scuffed one to point! Lyon earns reward for his diligent spell, and Roy becomes the third centurion to go no further than 101!
dabbed out to point
pushed out to cover
width outside off, slapped out to point
dabbed down through third man, finds space behind square and they think about the third, and think again
tucked off the legs for another single
outside off, angling in, Hales guides it into the covers with a controlled push
attempted drive, but not quite to the pitch of the ball. Scuffed back to the bowler
punched firmly out to the cover sweeper

Bairstow falls! No fifth hundred in seven for England's other opener, he tried to get too cute against the height of Billy Stanlake, looking to glide him down to third man, but Paine saw him coming and snaffled a too-thin deflection
outside off, punched firmly out to point to get off the mark straightaway
forward and blocked into the off side
a thrashing square drive from Hales, freeing his levers to crunch through to the cover sweeper
edged, but all along the ground! Not really a threat of a chance, but slip does well not to let that scud through to the rope
beaten outside off, and that is a beauty! Probably the first one that has genuinely beaten the bat in this innings.
punched out to the deep
left alone outside off stump. That is probably another first!
tapped to cover and a sharp single, soft hands making that decision easy enough
wide line, a thick under-edge, and away through to fine leg. That'll do
good follow-up, tighter to the stumps, demanding a respectful forward press from the lanky Hales
opens the face, and glides a drive to point
pace from Stanlake! Root rides the bounce with a flinch, and gloves a single to the leg side
pressed with a hop, out through backward point. Lots of runs there today
full length, defended back down the pitch, this has been good from Australia, just turning what's left of their screw on the England batsmen
solidly into line to drive to mid-off
snorter! This one bursts past the edge as Root flinches inside the line
onto the front foot, Australia are brawling, and Stanlake looks the likely lad
big appeal as Hales is rapped on the pad, but that seems to be sliding down as they decline the review
punched on the up to mid-on, Hales is being very watchful at the top of his innings ... such a contrast to Tuesday
slower ball, defended into the leg side
tailing in on the leg stump, and clipped to the leg side
there's some shape here for Stoinis, swinging late into Hales' toes. Punched with a high elbow back down the pitch
back of a length, tight line, clubbed to mid-off
defended into the off side
on the pads, clipped urgently to short midwicket
pushed to the off side
back of a length, Root lines up the pull but is hit amidships. Good wheels from Billy Whizz
firm defence with a high elbow, back down the pitch
width, and kangaroo-cut over third man, one bounce to the man set back on the rope
met with a front-footed punch back down the pitch
too short this time, and comfortably pulled into the gap at deep midwicket
slower ball, good thinking, but far too short and too easily clobbered off the toe of the bat, away through cow corner
fuller length, tailed into the pads, and worked behind square
flicked off the pads once more
punched into the covers
punched firmly off the back foot, out to deep cover

edged and dropped by Paine! Oh Lordy, that is horrendous. A catching-practice deflection from Hales, outside off and dangled through to the keeper, who stooped and let the edge bobble straight out! Oh dear...
worked to the leg side this time. Australia seem a bit stunned by that let-off
pushed into the off side
a touch of movement away from the right-hander, and dabbed to gully
over-pitched this time, and drilled back down the ground, takes Neser's boot as it goes by, but that is too well timed and rolls all the way to the rope
tossed up and punched back to the bowler
an open-faced punch into the covers
Root is pushed back into his crease this time, and defends once more
yawned over the leg side, a massive swing and that flies all the way! 'I don't hit many sixes, but I know I got that one,' says Root to Paine over the stump cam!
punched back to the bowler
forward and drilled down to long-off
leaning back, mown over deep midwicket, if you miss your length you get punished on this pitch
much better length, Root stretches forward this time
whipped to midwicket
guided down to third man for another single
dabbed to the off side, better length now from Neser
keeps low as Hales adjusts late, albeit with no footwork, and jabs down to defend his timbers
pushed into the covers
driven on the up to long-on
punched from deep in the crease, snaffled in the followthrough

a loose mow across the line and Root is bowled! He was eyeing up the slog-sweep with a big gap on the leg side, but credit to Agar, he held this one back in the flight and Root was through his shot too soon!
goes deep in the crease to work his first single into the leg side
onto the front foot, and punched into the covers
back of a length, tapped out to the leg side. Singles will suffice for England
blocked back down the track
opens the face and guides out to point
punched to short cover once more
back of a length, clipped out to deep midwicket
worked off the front foot back down the pitch but grabbed in the follow-through
paddy-whacked through backward point! He's so quick and effective on that shot, reversing the hands and just pulling the lone fielder hither and thither
punched in front of square this time, on the back foot
plants the front foot, and boshes one over the top. Not quite timed but impressive intent from the captain
nailed in front of square once again
outside off, quicker through the air, and that sounds like a fat edge to the keeper! Morgan is reviewing, not entirely sure why, and yep, there's a big spike on Snicko. Morgan is gone!
back of a length and punched through point from the crease
touch short outside off and Buttler gets off the mark first ball with a steer square
comes across and taps into the covers
fullish outside off, Hales runs the ball behind point for a single
pitched up, Buttler taps into the covers
back of a length, bit if width and he throws the hands through a slice behind deep point for two
angled in and tapped back to the bowler
tossed up, Hales drives along the ground back into Agar's hands
flighted, Hales is through his shot a little early and chips in front of extra cover, 'catch!' bellows Agar but it lands safely, brings up England's 250
pushed through and tapped to extra cover
flat on the stumps, Buttler nurdles to midwicket
ouch, that's some wristy power, crunched off the back foot past midwicket and the man in the deep can't get around the rope to cut it off... First boundary for Buttler
short outside off and sliced down to third man
stops a touch in the pitch, Hales chips in the air but clears cover and gets away with it again!
length, driven hard on the up through the off side
dug in short and Hales pulls through square leg
Buttler swats the ball for one more
pitched up and this skips through low underneath the bat
shortish outside off and chopped into the covers
full in the channel, Hales clamps down and gets a toe-end towards third man
short ball, Buttler latches on and hammers a pull way through backwards square
short of a length in the channel and Buttler blitzes a cut, uppish but clears the dive of backward point and races for four more
comes across and pushes into the covers
Richardson drops short and Hales collars him this time, smote through in front of midwicket and the fielder hasn't a hope!
back of a length and defended to leg
good nut from Stanlake, seaming back in as Hales hangs back, gets an inside edge on to his pads
short and wide, goes to cut but rather plops it towards backward point
chopped into the off side, Buttler calls him through for a tight single
woof! Pick that out... Buttler stand still on off, waits on the overpitched delivery and then blaps it through the covers! The equivalent of sticking a free-kick right in the top corner
full and dabbed through the off side for one more to keep the strike
full, slips this one under the bat as Buttler swings and misses
wristy power, full in the channel and slashed away behind point, opening the face and finding the gap
ah, that's a genuine half-volley, Buttler steps on to the front foot and hoofs it over mid-off, bounces just in front of the rope
comes down and prods into a gap
bit of width, Hales flashes hard and squirts a third boundary in the over through backward point
on the stumps, turned into the leg side for one
tossed up on the stumps, clipped through mid-on
nudged with the spin to square leg
pushed through outside off and Buttler pings it to point
pushed through and Buttler again finds the infield on the off side
tossed up and spinning through the gate, Buttler plays around it but it beats Paine, too, and they nick a bye
comes across on off and prods away
sliding down the leg side
power from Buttler again, a low full toss and that bottom hand comes through to club four more through cover
length, poked into the off side
high full toss, Buttler sees it big and slugs a home run into the crowd at deep midwicket! That's a no-ball on height, but didn't stop him smashing six!
spooned straight up, this will be caught coming in from long-on... but they run two while it's in the air, bringing up Buttler's fifty from 28 balls! Phew
overpitched, Buttler fires one final bottom-handed blast over cover, seals a six-wicket win for England!
